taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe astereae;genus solidago;section solidago;subsection maritimae;species sempervirens;subspecies sempervirens

bio:treatment.description: Involucres 4–7 mm. Rays 12–17. Disc florets ca. 17–22. 2n =18.
Dunes and sandy pockets in rocks by ocean, edges of brackish marshes;
N.B., Nfld. and Labr. (Nfld.), N.S., Ont., P.E.I., Que.; Conn., Del., Ill., Maine, Md., Mass., Mich., N.H., N.J., N.Y., Ohio, Pa., R.I., Va.
bio:treatment.discussion: Subspecies sempervirens is introduced in Illinois, Michigan, Ohio, and Ontario near salt mines and brackish waters down stream. It grows along the coast from Newfoundland to New Jersey and locally to Virginia.
